intro: Glossoloma tetragonoides, commonly known as the four-angled balsam, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its distinctive four-angled stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically bright red or orange, attracting pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
